trans-unit.source: DECIMAL provides an exact numeric in which the precision and scale can be arbitrarily sized. You can specify the precision (the total number of digits, both to the left and the right of the decimal point) and the scale (the number of digits of the fractional component). The amount of storage required is based on the precision.

seg-source.mrk: DECIMAL provides an exact numeric in which the precision and scale can be arbitrarily sized.
You can specify the precision (the total number of digits, both to the left and the right of the decimal point) and the scale (the number of digits of the fractional component).
The amount of storage required is based on the precision.

target.mrk: DECIMAL provides an exact numeric in which the precision and scale can be arbitrarily sized.
You can specify the precision (the total number of digits, both to the left and the right of the decimal point) and the scale (the number of digits of the fractional component).
The amount of storage required is based on the precision.

trans-unit.source: The precision must be between 1 and 31. The scale must be less than or equal to the precision.

seg-source.mrk: The scale must be less than or equal to the precision.

target.mrk: The scale must be less than or equal to the precision.

trans-unit.source: If the scale is not specified, the default scale is 0. If the precision is not specified, the default precision is 5.

seg-source.mrk: If the scale is not specified, the default scale is 0.
If the precision is not specified, the default precision is 5.

target.mrk: If the scale is not specified, the default scale is 0.
If the precision is not specified, the default precision is 5.

trans-unit.source: An attempt to put a numeric value into a DECIMAL is allowed as long as any non-fractional precision is not lost. When truncating trailing digits from a DECIMAL value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> rounds down.

seg-source.mrk: An attempt to put a numeric value into a DECIMAL is allowed as long as any non-fractional precision is not lost.
When truncating trailing digits from a DECIMAL value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> rounds down.

target.mrk: An attempt to put a numeric value into a DECIMAL is allowed as long as any non-fractional precision is not lost.
When truncating trailing digits from a DECIMAL value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> rounds down.

trans-unit.source: -- this cast loses only fractional precision values cast (1.798765 AS decimal(5,2)); 1 -------- 1.79 -- this cast does not fit values cast (1798765 AS decimal(5,2)); 1 -------- ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type DECIMAL/NUMERIC(5,2).

seg-source.mrk: -- this cast loses only fractional precision values cast (1.798765 AS decimal(5,2)); 1 -------- 1.79 -- this cast does not fit values cast (1798765 AS decimal(5,2)); 1 -------- ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type DECIMAL/NUMERIC(5,2).

target.mrk: -- this cast loses only fractional precision values cast (1.798765 AS decimal(5,2)); 1 -------- 1.79 -- this cast does not fit values cast (1798765 AS decimal(5,2)); 1 -------- ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type DECIMAL/NUMERIC(5,2).

trans-unit.source: When mixed with other data types in expressions, the resulting data type follows the rules shown in <xref href="rrefsqlj27767.dita#rrefsqlj27767"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: When mixed with other data types in expressions, the resulting data type follows the rules shown in <xref href="rrefsqlj27767.dita#rrefsqlj27767"></xref>.

target.mrk: When mixed with other data types in expressions, the resulting data type follows the rules shown in <xref href="rrefsqlj27767.dita#rrefsqlj27767"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: When two decimal values are mixed in an expression, the scale and precision of the resulting value follow the rules shown in <xref href="rrefsqlj36146.dita#rrefsqlj36146"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: When two decimal values are mixed in an expression, the scale and precision of the resulting value follow the rules shown in <xref href="rrefsqlj36146.dita#rrefsqlj36146"></xref>.

target.mrk: When two decimal values are mixed in an expression, the scale and precision of the resulting value follow the rules shown in <xref href="rrefsqlj36146.dita#rrefsqlj36146"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: Integer constants too big for BIGINT are made DECIMAL constants.

seg-source.mrk: Integer constants too big for BIGINT are made DECIMAL constants.

target.mrk: Integer constants too big for BIGINT are made DECIMAL constants.
